title: Hans Silfverberg
content:
Hans Silfverberg (b. 1943) is a Finnish entomologist from the Finnish Museum of Natural History.[1] The beetle species Apion silfverbergi,[2] Hyperaspis silfverbergi,[3] and Sasajiscymnus silfverbergi are named in his honour.[4]

He has described the following taxa, among others:

Among his scientific contributions is a list of the Coleoptera present in the Baltic and Nordic countries, which he published in 1992.[8]
